title: Rod Rosenstein
added: Concerns about a possible counterintelligence threat posed by Trump's personal and financial dealings with Russia increased after his May 9 firing of Comey, prompting the FBI to open an inquiry separate from the [[Crossfire Hurricane]] investigation and the incipient [[Mueller investigation]]. Within days, Rosenstein curtailed that inquiry, giving the bureau the impression that Mueller would pursue it, though Rosenstein instructed Mueller not to, effectively ending the inquiry.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/30/us/politics/trump-russia-justice-department.html|title=Justice Dept. Never Fully Examined Trump’s Ties to Russia, Ex-Officials Say|first=Michael S.|last=Schmidt|date=August 30, 2020|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>

title: Rod Rosenstein
added: ''The New York Times'' reported in August 2020 that concernsabout a possible counterintelligence threat posed by Trump's personal and financial dealings with Russia increased after his May 9 firing of Comey, prompting the FBI to open an inquiry separate from the [[Crossfire Hurricane]] investigation and the incipient [[Mueller investigation]]. Within days, Rosenstein curtailed that inquiry, giving the bureau the impression that Mueller would pursue it, though Rosenstein instructed Mueller not to, effectively ending the inquiry.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/30/us/politics/trump-russia-justice-department.html|title=Justice Dept. Never Fully Examined Trump’s Ties to Russia, Ex-Officials Say|first=Michael S.|last=Schmidt|date=August 30, 2020|via=NYTimes.com}}</ref>
